intro: Rodriguezia bifolia, commonly known as the twin-leaf rodriguezia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into several lobes, and its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
